__e: Ahem, well, Pete Berg's office called and he needs to be at the studio tomorrow for a camera test.

The hospital has no record of anybody calling you to say I was dead.
They called from-from work, and someone is sick today, so I'm going to have to go in and work probably.
I was right here, and then work called, and it's so fucked up, 'cause they can't do anything without me.
The last attack happened when the preschool called too?
Oh, but the dean's office called. They want to see you tomorrow.
Two hours later I get a call from the school saying she'd done this to her eye.
So what happened when they called the number?
I DON'T KNOW WHY THEY DIDN'T CALL YOUR AGENT INSTEAD OF ME.
She went home, the neighbours called 911, they said she ran off north and that's where the cops are looking but I think she's gone to the school.
Why? Because there are so very many idiots in this world, and they all called your mother.
They phoned the house on Saturday morning and told me not to come back in.
Oh, see, now that's where it gets confusing 'cause when their friends called the jail down there, the deputy said he had never heard of them.
They phoned the house on Saturday morning and told me not to come back in.
Then he got a call and told me to get lost.
This was the song... It was on the radio the night they called me and they told me my husband had been killed in a fight in a beerjoint.
Listen, before I forget, my parents called and they're in town and they want to have dinner with us tonight. I said we'd go to Du-Ays. - How's that sound?
The first time those kidnappers called you and said they had your wife, they gave you a where and a when for an exchange, didn't they?
You guys call me, and then you tell me I can't see my wife, who you put into a coma?
What does this mean to us?
His name's on your insurance, so they called him and he flew out last night.
That's what I was doing when security came. They called you.
I'm sorry ; if you didn't get a phone call last week, you're not eligible.
